cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 115 miles south-southeast of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest today, then turning north on Saturday toward the central Louisiana coast and up the Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City, central Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle; Lake Pontchartrain and Maurepas including metropolitan New Orleans; Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Texas across all of coastal Louisiana to the Mississippi and Alabama coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–65 mph) expected at the port by early Saturday with a brief chance of hurricane-force gusts near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of inundation possible along the lower Mississippi River, Lake Pontchartrain, and adjoining waterways that service the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches of rainfall with isolated totals to 25 inches could produce life-threatening flash and river flooding in and around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes in outer rainbands; prolonged high river stages on the Mississippi hinder drainage and could disrupt port logistics.
